Detailed Description

Substance callbacks signatures and related defines.

Author:
Christophe Soum - Allegorithmic (christophe.soum@allegorithmic.com)
Note:
This file is part of the Substance engine headers
Date:
20080108
Copyright (c) Allegorithmic. All rights reserved.
Defines callback function signatures used by handle and context structures.

Typedef Documentation

void SubstanceCallbackFree

Type of the 'system memory de-allocation' callback function. 

 void (*)(void* bufferPtr)

This callback allows to free buffers allocated with the SubstanceCallbackMalloc callback.
The 'bufferPtr' parameter is the buffer to free.

void SubstanceCallbackFreeEx

Type of the 'extended memory de-allocation' callback function. 

 void (*)(unsigned int flags,void* bufferPtr)

This callback allows to free buffers allocated with the SubstanceCallbackMallocEx callback.
The 'flags' parameter is a combination of 'SubstanceMallocExFlag' enums. Specifies the platform memory type to de-allocate.
The 'bufferPtr' parameter is the buffer to free.

void SubstanceCallbackJobCompleted

Type of the 'render job completed' callback function. 

 void (*)(SubstanceHandle* handle,size_t jobUserData)

This callback is called when Substance finishes a job and is about to start the next job in the render list.
The 'handle' parameter is the Substance handle that calls this callback func.
'jobUserData' is the integer/pointer set by the user at the creation of this job.

void * SubstanceCallbackMalloc

Type of the 'system memory allocation' callback function. 

 void* (*)(unsigned int bytesCount,unsigned int alignment)

This callback allows to use user-defined dynamic memory allocation.
The 'bytesCount' parameter is the number of bytes to allocate.
The 'alignment' parameter is the required buffer address alignment.
Must return the corresponding buffer.

void * SubstanceCallbackMallocEx

Type of the 'extended system memory allocation' callback function.

Warning:
This callback must be implemented on some platforms. Please see the platform specific Substance documentation.
 void* (*)(
        unsigned int flags,
        unsigned int bytesCount,
        unsigned int alignment)

This callback extend the SubstanceCallbackMalloc callback. In addition, it allows the allocation of platform specific memory buffer types.

The 'flags' parameter is a combination of 'SubstanceMallocExFlag' enums. Specifies the platform memory type to allocate.
The 'bytesCount' parameter is the number of bytes to allocate.
The 'alignment' parameter is the required buffer address alignment.
Must return the corresponding buffer.

If this callback is not defined or it returns NULL, the 'SubstanceCallbackMalloc' callback is used instead. If the latter is not defined too, default memory allocation is used.

void SubstanceCallbackOutOfMemory

Type of the 'out of memory' callback function. 

 void (*)(SubstanceHandle* handle,int memoryType)

This callback is called when Substance runs out of memory. The 'handle' parameter is the Substance handle that calls this callback func.
The 'memoryType' parameter is the memory concerned: -1: system memory, 0: video memory of the first GPU, 1: video memory of the second GPU, etc.

void SubstanceCallbackOutputCompleted

Type of the 'result output texture completed' callback function. 

 void (*)(SubstanceHandle* handle,unsigned int outputIndex,
        size_t jobUserData)

This callback is called every time an output texture has been rendered.
The 'handle' parameter is the Substance handle that calls this callback func.
The 'outputIndex' parameter is the index of the completed output.
'jobUserData' is the user information of the job corresponding to this output.

void * SubstanceCallbackOutputMalloc

Type of the 'result output texture allocation' callback function.

Warning:
Only valid with the BLEND Substance platform.
 void* (*)(
        struct SubstanceHandle_ *handle,
        size_t jobUserData,
        unsigned int outputIndex,
        unsigned int mipmapLevel,
        unsigned int *pitch,        // Input, output
        unsigned int bytesCount,
        unsigned int alignment)

This callback is called for each mipmap level every time an output texture destination buffer is required.
It allows the user to put the output in a specific memory location.

The 'handle' parameter is the Substance handle that calls this callback function.
'jobUserData' is the user information of the job corresponding to this output.
The 'outputIndex' parameter is the index of the completed output.
The 'mipmapLevel' parameter is the mipmap level of the output (0: base level).
The 'pitch' parameter is a pointer to the size of a pixel row (or size of a block row for compressed formats) in bytes. The user must modify it if a non-default pitch is required.
The 'bytesCount' parameter is the number of bytes to allocate. It is a minimal value: the allocated buffer can actually be larger if the pitch is tweaked by the user, in which case this value can be discarded.
The 'alignment' parameter is the required buffer address alignment.
Must return the corresponding buffer. This buffer will be accessed only for write operations (no read operations: the buffer returned can be in mapped video memory or equivalent).

void SubstanceCallbackProgress

Type of the progress callback function. 

 void (*)(SubstanceHandle* handle,unsigned int progress,
        unsigned int progressMax)

The 'handle' parameter is the Substance handle that calls this callback func.
The 'progress' parameter varies between 0 and progressMax-1.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum SubstanceCallbackEnum

Callback types enumeration.

Platform dependent definitions This enumeration is used to name callbacks in the Substance context structure.

Enumerator:
Substance_Callback_Progress 
Substance_Callback_MallocEx 
Substance_Callback_OutputCompleted 
Substance_Callback_OutOfMemory 
Substance_Callback_JobCompleted 
Substance_Callback_Malloc 
Substance_Callback_Free 
Substance_Callback_FreeEx 
Substance_Callback_OutputMalloc 
Substance_Callback_Internal_Count 

enum SubstanceMallocExFlag

MallocEx Callback flags enumeration.

This enumeration is used by the Substance_Callback_MallocEx callback. Specifies the platform memory type to allocate (exclusive flags).

Enumerator:
Substance_MallocEx_MemTypeSystem  system memory type (dflt.)
Substance_MallocEx_MemTypeVideo  video memory type
Substance_MallocEx_MemTypeMapped  mapped main memory type
